p: With regard to EEM supplementation, the reported data ( Table 4) agree with those of Shalash et al. [ 32], who observed that yolk color density increased significantly due to enzyme addition to the diets of laying hens. Ghazalah et al. [ 22] found that hens fed a 75% DDGS diet substituted for soybean meal, with Avizyme supplementation, had a significantly higher egg yolk color score than the other treatment groups. This might be due to the dietary pigmentation released from cell wall contents [ 43]. On the contrary, Deniz et al. [ 23] and Jiang et al. [ 44] reported that yolk color was not significantly influenced by enzyme cocktail supplementation at any inclusion level of corn DDGS.
